name: The Center for Hellenic Studies, Technical Working Group
tagline: The Center for Hellenic Studies, Technical Working Group
body:
## What we're developing


With the sponsorship of the [Center for Hellenic Studies](http://chs.harvard.edu/), we are maintaining an inventory of unique identifiers for for ancient Greek texts transmitted by manuscript copying. See the repository for the `greekLit` [namespace for Canonical Text Services](https://github.com/chs-tg/greekLit).

While these identifiers are independent of any particular technology, their strictly defined syntax and semantics makes them ideal for machine processing with the CITE architecture. In contrast to the repository of identifiers for Greek texts, the CITE architecture is generically applicable, so we have made our work on it available through its own separate github organization: <http://cite-architecture.github.io/>.

We thank especially the Director of the CHS, Gregory Nagy;  the Director of IT and Publications at CHS, Leonard Muellner;  and the co-editors of the Homer Multitext project, Casey Du√© and Mary Ebbott.


Christopher Blackwell and Neel Smith
